div.head: AN ADVERTISEMENT to the Reader.
div.p: IT falleth out often with Students in controuersies, as with people in the market: who taking money with them at their going from home, and espying in the fayre some Merchandize they like, when they haue driuen the Price, and are drawing out their purse, they find it either pickt, or the strings cut: In like maner, these Students meeting with some pregnāt testimonies alleaged out of the ancient Fathers, or later Writers in Apologies for the Truth, and laying them vp in their memory, or treasurie of writen notes, when they are to draw them out, and make vse of them against an aduersarie, turning to the Authors themselues, out of which those testimonies are quoted, they find either the whole booke, or chapter cut away, or at least, that passage they most spake for, rased out by a tricke of the Romish Inquisitors Leger de maine. That thou mightest not be so serued, or haue any tricke put vpon thee in the perusall of this booke, I haue here in a Tablet set before thee, all the Authors of note, with the Editions which I follow: where thou shalt vndoubtedly find the parcell of truth thou seekest for, and not the emptie shells onely, wherewith thou mayst be abused in other Editions, castrated by the Romanists.
